The CWC staff have been working diligently to ensure that we are all off to a great start on August 24th. The remote learning experience will provide a healthy balance of on-screen and off-screen learning opportunities. Each class will have a set time slot of live instructional learning as well as check-ins three times per week. Please expect 3-4 hours per day of individual work from a variety of sources. These will include physical materials- provided by CWC, project-based assignments, regular reading and writing assignments, and some work to be completed through on-line resources

In addition to instructional learning, each student will have a weekly 1:1 check-in with their teacher.
We will still incorporate music, art, PE, and computer once a week as well.

We miss our student's sweet faces! It is a must that we still have whole school opportunities, such as Friday Sing. This year, we plan to kick it up a notch with a speaker series, with community leaders and innovators, as well as a weekly Middle School community circle.

We recently released our reopening plan. We will be 100% remote beginning August 24th with the goal to re-open in accordance with a phased approach. This decision was made based upon the safety of our students, staff, and community. Please know that we miss our students dearly and cannot wait until we can all gather again in the same space. We will follow the following phases for reopening:

1. Remote Learning: Students will experience a perfectly balanced on screen/off screen learning environment. We will start on August 24th.

2. Remote Plus: Students will continue to work remotely with access to the building for approved support services.

3. Hybrid- Students will have the choice to return to school two days a week with A/B cohorts.

4. Limited- All students will have the choice to return to school M, T, Th, and Fri. Wednesday will be utilized for deep cleaning and professional development.

If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to returntoschool@cwckansascity.org

Third graders opened their Missouri Museum today! They were so excited to share their favorite topics about our state through self-selected, researched, and designed exhibits and performances.

Visitors learned that new laws in Missouri all start with an idea! The state animal is the mule, the state reptile is the three-toed box turtle, and the state game bird is the bobwhite quail, which, according to one of our third graders, "roam freely all over our streets, like really, they are running around in my street all of the time."

We played hoops with the three branches of government and had faces painted by clowns. If you chose the right cup, one student would tell you all about your individual rights, and even if you didn't choose the right cup, he would still tell you about your individual rights because, according to him, that's just the kind of kid he is. Way to go, third grade!
